```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)
library(dplyr)
library(magick)
library(ggforce)
library(cowplot)
```

This vignette presents the code to produce 3 vintage data visualizations built from the `iris` dataset (1936): 

- Relationship between width and length of sepals for three varieties of iris
- 
- 

```{r}
#extrafont::font_import()
backgound_image <- png::readPNG("images/vintage_paper.png")

data_image_iris <- tibble::tibble(
  Species = iris %>% distinct(Species) %>% pull(),
  image = c("images/iris_1.png", "images/iris_2.png", "images/iris_3.png")
)
```

### Relationship between width and length of sepals for three varieties of iris

```{r out.width="891px", out.height="630px"}
# Construire le plot de base
plot_sepal_wl <- iris %>% 
  left_join(data_image_iris,
            by = "Species") %>% 
  ggplot() +
  ggpubr::background_image(backgound_image) + 
  aes(x = Sepal.Width, y = Sepal.Length) +
  geom_point(alpha = 0.5, color = "#5E5E5E") + 
  geom_mark_ellipse(aes(group = Species, label = Species), 
                    linetype = 3, 
                    color = "#5E5E5E", 
                    label.family = "1942 report",
                    label.colour = "#5E5E5E", 
                    label.fontsize = 10,
                    label.fill = NA, 
                    con.linetype = 1, 
                    con.colour = "#5E5E5E")
  
# Extraire la composition du plot
plot_sepal_wl_build <- ggplot_build(plot_sepal_wl)

# Trouver les centroïdes des ellipses
data_centroid_min_max_ellipses <- plot_sepal_wl_build$data[[3]] %>% 
  as_tibble() %>%
  select(x, y, group) %>% 
  mutate(Species = case_when(
    group == 1 ~ levels(iris$Species)[1],
    group == 2 ~ levels(iris$Species)[2],
    group == 3 ~ levels(iris$Species)[3]
  )) %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  summarise(centroid_x = mean(x), 
            centroid_y = mean(y),
            .groups = "drop") %>% 
  left_join(data_image_iris,
            by = "Species")

# Ajouter les images des iris dans les ellipses
plot_sepal_wl <- plot_sepal_wl +
  draw_image(image = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(1) %>% select(image) %>% pull(), 
             x = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(1) %>% select(centroid_x) %>% pull(), 
             y = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(1) %>% select(centroid_y) %>% pull(), 
             hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5, scale = 1.5) +
  draw_image(image = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(2) %>% select(image) %>% pull(), 
             x = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(2) %>% select(centroid_x) %>% pull(), 
             y = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(2) %>% select(centroid_y) %>% pull(), 
             hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5, scale = 1.5) +
  draw_image(image = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(3) %>% select(image) %>% pull(), 
             x = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(3) %>% select(centroid_x) %>% pull(), 
             y = data_centroid_min_max_ellipses %>% slice(3) %>% select(centroid_y) %>% pull(), 
             hjust = 0.5, vjust = 0.5, scale = 1.5) 

# Limites
plot_sepal_wl <- plot_sepal_wl +
  scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.1, 0.1)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0.1, 1))

# Titres
plot_sepal_wl <- plot_sepal_wl +
  labs(title = "Relationship between width and length\nof sepals for three varieties of iris",
       subtitle = "iris dataset 1936",
       x = "Sepal width", 
       y = "Sepal length")

# Thème
plot_sepal_wl <- plot_sepal_wl +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(family = "1942 report", size = 22),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(family = "Chorettan", size = 22),
    axis.title = element_text(family = "Chorettan", size = 25),
    axis.text = element_text(family = "Chorettan", size = 10),
    plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#F2EFD5"),
    panel.border = element_rect(fill = NA, color = "#D0C4A5", size = 1)
  )

# Save
ggsave(filename = "exports/plot_sepal_wl.pdf", 
       plot = plot_sepal_wl, 
       device = cairo_pdf, 
       width = 297, 
       height = 210, 
       units = "mm")

knitr::include_graphics("exports/plot_sepal_wl.pdf")
```

### Plot 2 

```{r}
iris %>% 
  count(Species) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = Species, y = n) +
  geom_col()
```

### Plot 3

```{r}
iris %>% 
  group_by(Sepal.Length) %>% 
  summarise(Petal.Length = mean(Petal.Length)) %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Petal.Length) +
  geom_line()
```
